title: (x) Cloud Corner type ID - geometric spurless sans - Moderna {R}
content:
One more type ID before I call it a night on this logo I'm working on. Can anyone ID the type in this cloud corner logo?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141024022150im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logos_28_5633.jpg)
author: sarahcazee

comments.content: [P22 Bayer Universal](http://web.archive.org/web/20141024022150/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/bayer-universal/?testdrive=custom%3D37994%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3Dcloudcorner%26size%3D44%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3DFFFFFF%26w%3D720%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26dock%3Dfalse%26seed%3D27) is close, though the /r/s are different.

This seems to be [Moderna](http://web.archive.org/web/20141024022150/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=FOLI-MODE#), maybe with a slight stroke added. You can get a free try-out version with an incomplete character set [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141024022150/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=moderna&page=1&nb_ppp_old=10&text=cloudcorner&nb_ppp=10&psize=l&classt=alpha).
Ohh, thanks for the try-out version tip! This is an interesting little typeface, I really like the lowercase.
You’re welcome! Always a pleasure to help.
